Description:
DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO OPERATION FUEL, THE COUNTRY'S OLDEST FUEL FUND, TO ENABLE THE ORGANIZATION TO DEVELOP THEIR BETTER HOMES AND BUILDINGS PROGRAM TO ADDRESS BARRIERS, WEATHERIZE HOMES AND INSTALL HEAT PUMPS IN LOW- AND MODERATE-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES ACROSS CONNECTICUT WHICH THE ORGANIZATION LAUNCHED LAST YEAR, AND THIS YEAR'S PROJECT WILL BUILD ON PREVIOUS EFFORTS AND FOCUS MAINLY IN BRIDGEPORT. ACCORDING TO THE ORGANIZATION'S WORKPLAN, HEAT PUMPS TRANSFER HEAT FROM A COOL SPACE TO A WARM SPACE AND DO THIS WITH 50% GREATER EFFICIENCY THAN ELECTRIC RESISTANCE BASEBOARDS AND WINDOW AIR CONDITIONING UNITS. HEAT PUMPS ELIMINATE THE NEED FOR INEFFICIENT HEATING AND COOLING SYSTEMS, SUCH AS FOSSIL FUELED FURNACES OR BOILERS AND WINDOW- OR PORTABLE AIR CONDITIONERS, WHICH IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND SAVE ON FOSSIL FUEL USAGE. OUTREACH WILL BE DIRECTED TO LOW- AND MODERATE-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS IN BRIDGEPORT, A CITY THAT QUALIFIES AS AN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITY DEFINED BY THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY AS ONE DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH BURDENS.ACTIVITIES:THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF OPERATION FUEL'S BETTER HOMES AND BUILDING PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE THE UTILIZATION OF CONNECTICUT'S WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM AND INSTALL UP TO 10-15 HEAT PUMPS IN SINGLE FAMILY HOMES AND MULTI-RESIDENT RENTAL UNITS BY SEPTEMBER 2024, THEREBY DECREASING ENERGY BURDEN, CARBON FOOTPRINT, AND NEGATIVE HEALTH IMPACTS. OPERATION FUEL AND NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSING SERVICES WILL CONDUCT A CONSUMER AWARENESS AND EDUCATION CAMPAIGN THAT WILL REACH 4,000-5,000 RESIDENTS. THE EDUCATIONAL TOPICS WILL FOCUS ON INCENTIVES AROUND HEAT PUMPS, ENERGY EFFICIENCY TIPS AND WEATHERIZATION. OPERATION FUEL PLANS TO REQUEST 10-15 COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS OR LEADERS TO SHARE PROGRAM INFORMATION WITH THEIR NETWORKS. THE ORGANIZATIONS PLAN TO PROMOTE THE PROGRAM ON SOCIAL MEDIA WITH 20-30 SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS ACROSS FACEBOOK, LINKEDIN, INSTAGRAM AND TWITTER WITH A TOTAL OF 6,000-8,000 EXPECTED IMPRESSIONS AND 1,500 TO 2,000 PAGE VISITS. IN ADDITION, OPERATION FUEL WILL CONDUCT AN EMAIL CAMPAIGN WITH AT LEAST 6 EMAILS TO 6,000 TO 7,000 SUBSCRIBERS WITH AN AVERAGE 30% OPEN RATE AND 5% CLICK RATE. THE ORGANIZATION PLANS TO IDENTIFY 200 CLIENTS AS POTENTIAL ENROLLEES IN THE PROJECT WITH ABOUT 15-20 CLIENTS COMPLETING APPLICATIONS TO BEGIN ENROLLMENT IN PROGRAM. IN ADDITION, THERE ARE PLANS TO CONDUCT 4 EDUCATION WORKSHOPS (OFFERED IN-PERSON AND VIRTUALLY) WITH ENERGIZE-CONNECTICUT, WHICH IS A PARTNERSHIP AMONG THE STATE, NONPROFITS AND ENERGY COMPANIES ON CONSUMER ENERGY EFFICIENCY TO TALK TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS ABOUT THE BENEFITS OF INSTALLING HEAT PUMPS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:OPERATION FUEL WILL ALSO TRACK OTHER HEALTH AND NON-ENERGY BENEFITS ACHIEVED. THE PROJECT OUTCOMES INCLUDE:
#61623; REDUCED BARRIERS TO SOCIAL AND STRUCTURAL CAUSES OF HOME ENERGY AFFORDABILITY BY PROVIDING INCREASED RESOURCES TO BRIDGEPORT RESIDENTS INCREASING UNDERSTANDING AND REDUCTION OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND HUMAN HEALTH RISKS THROUGH EDUCATIONAL TOOLS.
#61623; DELIVER A CLEANER, SAFER, AND HEALTHIER ENVIRONMENT FOR ALL CONNECTICUT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS (STRATEGIC GOAL 1) BY CREATING MEASURABLE IMPROVEMENTS IN ENERGY EFFICIENCY IN PARTICIPATING HOMES LEADING TO A NUMBER OF POUNDS OR METRIC TONS OF GREENHOUSE GAS ELIMINATED; REDUCTION IN KILOWATT-HOURS OF ENERGY USED; AND IMPROVED INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND MEASURABLE IMPROVEMENTS IN PUBLIC HEALTH INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO: IMPROVEMENT IN QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ASTHMATICS, INCLUDING AN INCREASED NUMBER OF SYMPTOM-FREE DAYS;
#61623; MORE EFFECTIVE PARTNERSHIPS ACROSS SECTORS AND COMMUNITIES (STRATEGIC GOAL 2) AND CONNECTICUT LEGISLATORS ENGAGED IN ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND HUMAN HEALTH IMPROVEMENTS FOR RESIDENTS, ESPECIALLY IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES (STRATEGIC GOAL 3)

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO APPALACHIAN MOUNTAIN CLUB TO CONDUCT THEIR 'LIVING DOWNSTREAM' PROJECT WHICH FOCUSES ON COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IN ASSESSING AND UNDERSTANDING LEGACY MERCURY POLLUTION IN THE NORTHEAST.ACTIVITIES:THE LIVING DOWNSTREAM: COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IN ASSESSING AND UNDERSTANDING LEGACY MERCURY POLLUTION IN THE NORTHEAST PROJECT SEEKS TO ENGAGE COMMUNITIES TO COLLECT AQUATIC DRAGONFLY LARVAE BIOSENTINELS LINKED WITH FISH AND HUMAN HEALTH BENCHMARKS AND DOCUMENT LEGACY POLLUTION IN THE WATERSHED WITH HISTORICAL INFORMATION, REFINE CURRICULUM MODULE ON THE INDUSTRIAL HISTORY AND DEVELOP MODULE ON HG EXPOSURE AND RISK, WITH TEACHER AND PRACTITIONER INPUT AND GUIDANCE, TO DEPLOY IN FORMATS TARGETED FOR CLASSROOMS AND INFORMAL SCIENCE AUDIENCES, AND CONVENE A VIRTUAL (OR IN-PERSON) SYMPOSIUM FOR PARTICIPATING SCHOOLS AND GROUPS TO PRESENT RESULTS OF THEIR WORK.

SUBRECIPIENT:DARTMOUTH WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAIN CLUB TO CONTINUE TO ADAPT THE CURRENT DRAGONFLY MERCURY PROGRAM FOR COMMUNITIES IN URBAN AND INDUSTRIALIZED AREAS SUCH AS COMMUNITIES IN LOWELL-LAWRENCE AND PROVIDE TRAINING TO TEACHERS AND WORK WITH THEM IN THEIR CLASSROOMS. USING AN INQUIRY-BASED APPROACH, STUDENTS WILL BE GUIDED TO DEVELOP QUESTIONS THAT THEY WILL BE ABLE TO TEST WITH THEIR OWN DATA AND THOSE OF OTHER SITES.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF RELATIVE HG RISK IN THE WATERSHED AND BE MADE FINDABLE, ACCESSIBLE, AND RE-USEABLE TO THE STUDENTS AND TEACHERS; ACTIVE ENGAGEMENT IN SAMPLE COLLECTION AND DATA TO DRAW CONCLUSIONS ABOUT THE HEALTH OF THE LOCAL RIVERS; AND INCREASED STUDENT/YOUTH EXPERIENCE WITH THE SCIENTIFIC PROCESS AND RECOGNIZE THE IMPORTANCE OF ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE RESIDENTS LOWELL AND LAWRENCE, MA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADDRESS INDOOR AIR QUALITY AND ASTHMA PREVENTION IN VULNERABLE POPULATIONS, INCLUDING ELDERLY GROUPS, HARD TO REACH HISPANIC POPULATIONS, AND CHILDREN THROUGH EDUCATION SESSIONS THAT HAVE AND CONTINUE TO TRANSFORM LIVES.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO EMPOWER COMMUNITIES AND TRAIN PROMOTERS TO LEAD WORK TO REDUCE INDOOR AIR POLLUTION, ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES, AND INCREASE KNOWLEDGE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE RAISING AWARENESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS THAT HEALTH AND PARTICIPANTS ACTION TAKEN TO REDUCE EXPOSURES AND OR SEEK OUTSIDE SERVICES FROM COMMUNITY RESOURCES. HEALTHY HOME PROJECT OFFERS AN IMPORTANT AND REPLICABLE MODEL AND WILL RESULT IN CREATING HEALTHY HOMES BY IMPROVING THE AIR CONDITION AND EMPOWERING THE COMMUNITY WITH INFORMATION AND RESOURCES ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL AND OR PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES THROUGH EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS IN ASTHMA AND LEAD, MERCURY, AND OTHER POISONING PREVENTION AT TARGETED NEIGHBORHOODS (HARD TO REACH HISPANIC POPULATIONS AND CHILDREN).

THIS ASSISTANCE AWARD'S PURPOSE SEEKS TO TIE BOTH THE TARGET INVESTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AREAS OF POTENTIAL CONCERN AND THE TARGET PROGRAM AREA OF HEALTHY INDOOR ENVIRONMENTS TOGETHER TO COMBAT FOOD INSECURITY ON A STATE LEVEL IN RHODE ISLAND. THIS PROGRAM WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES THAT HAVE BEEN DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT RESULTING FROM WASTED FOOD AND THE GROWING PUBLIC HEALTH CONCERN OF HUNGER AND FOOD INSECURITY. ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES IMPROVING HEALTHY INDOOR ENVIRONMENTS THROUGH POLLUTION PREVENTION AND FOOD WASTE MINIMIZATION. THESE TWO TARGET AREAS WORK IN TANDEM BECAUSE PRESERVING INDOOR ENVIRONMENTS THROUGH ONGOING SUSTAINABILITY PRACTICES DIRECTLY CORRELATES TO IMPROVEMENT IN SOCIAL, HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE FOR VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. SOME ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES THAT WILL COME OF THE PARTNERSHIP IS TO STRATEGICALLY AND SYMBIOTICALLY WORK TOGETHER BY COMBINING THEIR AREAS OF EXPERTISE AND EXPERIENCE

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE INSTITUTE FOR LOCAL SELF-RELIANCE (ILSR)  TO CONDUCT THEIR 'COMPOSTING FOR COMMUNITY INITIATIVE.' EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE TRAIN COMMUNITY COMPOSTERS VIA ONLINE COMMUNITY COMPOSTER 101 CERTIFICATE COURSE, CREATE AND DISSEMINATE 6 ILSR COMPOSTING LEARNING ACTIVITIES, AND CREATE AND LAUNCH PEER LEARNING COMMUNITY (PLC). ACTIVITIES: THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO CULTIVATE COMMUNITY-SCALE COMPOSTING THAT WOULD SPECIFICALLY ALLOW ILSR TO EXPAND THE REACH OF THE NEW ONLINE COMMUNITY COMPOSTING 101 CERTIFICATE PROGRAM TO NEW ENGLAND, DEVELOP AND DISSEMINATE COMPOSTING TRAINING MATERIALS THAT COMMUNITY SITES CAN USE ON THEIR OWN, AND LAUNCH A COMMUNITY COMPOSTING PEER LEARNING COMMUNITY (PLC) TO SHARE TIPS FOR REPLICATION AND LESSONS LEARNED TO SPUR CROSS FERTILIZATION AND REPLICATION THROUGHOUT NEW ENGLAND AND BEYOND.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE TRAIN 400 COMMUNITY COMPOSTERS VIA ONLINE COMMUNITY COMPOSTER 101 CERTIFICATE COURSE, CREATE AND DISSEMINATE 6 ILSR COMPOSTING LEARNING ACTIVITIES, AND CREATE AND LAUNCH PEER LEARNING COMMUNITY (PLC) WITH APPROXIMATELY 36 PARTICIPANTS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF SIX NEW ENGLAND STATES OR 10 TRIBAL COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE NORTHEAST WASTE MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS' ASSOCIATION TO CONDUCT THEIR GREEN CLEANING AND DISINFECTING IN SOUTHERN NEW HAMPSHIRE PROJECT. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO EDUCATE JANITORIAL EMPLOYEES AND RESIDENTS IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES IN NASHUA AND MANCHESTER, NH ABOUT THE BENEFITS AND METHODS OF ADOPTING GREEN CLEANING PRODUCTS AND PRACTICES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE TRAINING OF 12 JANITORIAL STAFF AT THREE PROFESSIONAL CLEANING BUSINESSES, IMPACTING MORE THAN 1,000 HOUSEHOLDS. THIS WILL RESULT IN THE REDUCTION OF APPROXIMATELY 70 GALLONS OF CONVENTIONAL CLEANING PRODUCT AND HAZARDOUS CLEANING SUBSTANCES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE JANITORIAL STAFF WHO WILL AVOID EXPOSURE TO CHEMICALS THAT CAUSE ASTHMA AND CHEMICAL BURNS. RESIDENTS WILL ALSO BENEFIT FROM THE USE OF ENVIRONMENTALLY PREFERABLE CLEANING PRODUCTS.

DESCRIPTION:MEANS DATABASE HAS BEEN PARTNERED WITH THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (RIDOH) FOR THEIR 'RHODE TO END HUNGER' INITIATIVE SINCE 2017. OUR COLLABORATION CONNECTS EXCESS FOOD FROM BUSINESSES TO NEARBY NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE FOOD FOR THEIR COMMUNITY MEMBERS, AT NO COST TO THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS, CHARITIES, OR THE DONATING EATERIES. TO DATE, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH 141 FOOD BUSINESSES AND NONPROFITS ACROSS THE STATE, MEANS HAS RECOVERED 56,164 POUNDS OF FOOD AND 1,075 LBS OF FOOD SERVICE SUPPLIES, COMPRISING 46,803 MEALS AND PREVENTING 21,061 POUNDS OF EMISSIONS.

THIS PROPOSAL SEEKS TO TIE BOTH THE TARGET INVESTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AREAS OF POTENTIAL CONCERN AND THE TARGET PROGRAM AREA OF HEALTHY INDOOR ENVIRONMENTS TOGETHER TO COMBAT FOOD INSECURITY ON A STATE LEVEL IN RI AND IN BCM. THE PROPOSED PROGRAM WILL WORK CLOSELY WITHIN LOCAL COMMUNITIES THAT HAVE BEEN DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT RESULTING FROM WASTED FOOD AND THE GROWING PUBLIC HEALTH CONCERN OF HUNGER AND FOOD INSECURITY. ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES IMPROVING HEALTHY INDOOR
ENVIRONMENTS THROUGH POLLUTION PREVENTION AND FOOD WASTE MINIMIZATION. THESE TWO TARGET AREAS WORK IN TANDEM BECAUSE PRESERVING INDOOR ENVIRONMENTS THROUGH ONGOING SUSTAINABILITY PRACTICES DIRECTLY CORRELATES TO IMPROVEMENT IN SOCIAL, HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE FOR VULNERABLE POPULATIONS.

THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN RIDOH, MEANS AND RLC IS TO STRATEGICALLY AND SYMBIOTICALLY WORK TOGETHER BY COMBINING OUR AREAS OF EXPERTISE AND EXPERIENCE TO HELP END THE CONTINUOUS CYCLE OF INEQUITIES OF ECONOMIC, RACIAL, FOOD, ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH JUSTICE. IN OUR LAST GRANT, WE FOCUSED OUR EFFORTS IN PROVIDENCE, PAWTUCKET, CENTRAL FALLS AND WOONSOCKET, WHICH ARE AMONG THE MOST ECONOMICALLY CHALLENGED COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE. MEANS, RIDOH AND RLC WILL WORK TOGETHER TO EDUCATE FOOD DONORS ON THE ENVIRONMENTAL, ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL BENEFITS OF DONATING THEIR SURPLUS FOOD TO IGNITE IMMEDIATE AND LASTING IMPROVEMENTS IN THE FOOD SYSTEM, TO HELP MAKE RECOVERY OF SURPLUS CONSUMABLE FOOD A COMMON PRACTICE FOR BUSINESSES IN RI AND BCM.ACTIVITIES:MEANS DATABASE IS AN ONLINE PLATFORM CONNECTING BUSINESSES WITH EXCESS FOOD, SUCH AS GROCERY STORES, WAREHOUSES AND RESTAURANTS, WITH NEARBY EMERGENCY FOOD PROVIDERS WHO SERVE THOSE IN NEED. THE $41,760 TOTAL FOR THIS PROJECT WILL BE USED TO FUND THE COORDINATION AND TRANSPORTATION OF FOOD DONATIONS ACROSS THE STATE, AS WELL AS TO RECRUIT RECURRING FOOD DONATIONS FROM FOOD BUSINESSES AND FOOD PROVIDERS. THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD UPON THE FOUNDATION THAT MEANS, RLC AND RIDOH HAVE ESTABLISHED VIA OUR COLLABORATION FROM OUR FIRST GRANT TOGETHER, AND REPLICATE THAT FRAMEWORK IN BRISTOL COUNTY, MA (BCM). WE WILL BE CO-HOSTING AN ONLINE WEBINAR FOR THIS PURPOSE. IN THE LONG TERM, THE UNIQUE AND HIGHLY EFFECTIVE STRATEGIES OF EACH OF OUR ORGANIZATIONS COMPLEMENT OUR JOINT MISSION, THUS CREATING LONG-STANDING COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS TO BEST SERVE RI AND BCM.SUBRECIPIENT:WEB APPLICATION MAINTENANCE AND UPDATES, SOUTHCOAST MA CHAMBER OF COMMERCE MEMBERSHIP, WEB PLATFORM ENHANCEMENT, NORTHERN RI CHAMBER OF COMMERCE MEMBERSHIP, CENTRAL RI CHAMBER OF COMMERCE MEMBERSHIPOUTCOMES:MEANS DATABASE WILL MONITOR THE NUMBER OF FOOD BUSINESSES AND EMERGENCY FOOD PROVIDERS  SIGNED UP TO DONATE SURPLUS FOOD THAT IS SAFE FOR CONSUMPTION. BOTH MEANS AND RLC UTILIZE RESPECTIVE ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY FOR ALL OPERATIONS, AND EACH HAS THE CAPABILITY TO TRACK AND ANALYZE MULTIPLE STREAMS OF DATA TO MEASURE AND EVALUATE THE PROGRESS OF THE JOINT PROJECT, INCLUDING THE NUMBER OF DONORS, RESCUES, POUNDS OF FOOD RESCUED, MEALS PROVIDED, CO2 EMISSIONS PREVENTED, OUTREACH PERFORMED AND VOLUNTEER STATISTICS. THESE KEY DATA POINTS ARE EASILY TRACKED BY EACH OF THE ORGANIZATIONS SYSTEMS, INCLUDING CUSTOM, PURPOSE-BUILT PLATFORMS, AS WELL AS OUTSIDE TOOLS SUCH AS HUBSPOT AND SALESFORCE. PROJECT SUCCESS WILL BE ME

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO NORTHEAST RESOURCE RECOVERY ASSOCIATION TO CONDUCT THEIR 'INCREASING CONSTRUCTION AND DEMOLITIION (CANDD) DIVERSION IN COOUML;S COUNTY, NEW HAMPSHIRE PROJECT. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO: 
1. CONVENE THREE CANDD SUMMIT ROUNDTABLES FOR MUNICIPAL SOLID WASTE FACILITY OPERATORS TO SHARE BEST PRACTICES TO INCREASE CANDD DIVERSION AND REDUCE COSTS.
2. CONDUCT A PILOT PROGRAM IN LANCASTER, NEW HAMPSHIRE TO DEMONSTRATE TECHNIQUES TO INCREASE CANDD DIVERSION AND REDUCE COSTS.
3. PROVIDE HANDS-ON TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR THREE MUNICIPAL SOLID WASTE FACILITIES TO INCREASE CANDD DIVERSION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES FROM THE CANDD DIVERSION PROJECT INCLUDE: (1) AN INCREASE BY WEIGHT OF CANDD BEING DIVERTED FROM LANDFILLS  (2) A REDUCTION IN POUNDS OF GREENHOUSE GAS ('GHG') EMISSIONS FROM LANDFILLING CANDD ; (3) A REDUCTION OF CANDD MANAGEMENT COSTS TO PARITCIPATING MUNICIPALITES; AND (4) IMPROVED ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TOOLS TO INCREASE CANDD DIVERSION FOR MUNICIPALITIES .  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF TARGET COMMUNITIES WHO WILL HAVE A DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO WOONASQUATUCKET RIVER WATERSHED COUNCIL TO CONDUCT THEIR PROJECT TITLED, 'FRONTLINE COMMUNITIES FIRST! RESIDENTS BUILD CLIMATE RESILIENCE IN THE WOONASQUATUCKET RIVER WATERSHED'. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO BUILD CAPACITY OF RESIDENTS AND STUDENT LEADERS IN OLNEYVILLE AND MANTON, RHODE ISLAND TO DEVELOP AND PLAN PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS STORMWATER, SEA LEVEL RISE, POOR WATER, HABITAT QUALITY, URBAN HEAT ISLAND AND RIVERBANK EROSION AND SCOURING.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE FRONTLINE COMMUNITY MEMBERS OF OLNEYVILLE AND MANTON, RHODE ISLAND EXPERIENCE IMPROVED ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH OUTCOMES SUCH AS DECREASE INCIDENCE OF STORM AND SEA LEVEL RISE FLOODING, STREETS PROTECTED FROM RIVER EROSION, COOLER SUMMER TEMPERATURES, GREENER STREETSCAPES WITH INCREASED WILDLIFE HABITAT AND DIVERSITY. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF OLNEYVILLE AND MANTON, RHODE ISLAND.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO CITY OF MIDDLETOWN, CONNECTICUT TO CONDUCT THEIR FOSTERING CIRCULAR SOLUTIONS FOR TAKEOUT CONTAINERS PROJECT. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A REUSABLE CONTAINER PROGRAM AND OUTREACH CAMPAIGN THAT WILL ENGAGE CONSUMERS AND RESIDENTS FROM MIDDLETOWN, CONNECTICUT TO SHOWCASE HOW A REUSABLE CONTAINER PROGRAM CAN BE IMPLEMENTED THEREBY REDUCING WASTE GENERATION IN THE COMMUNITY. SUBRECIPIENT:AS IDENTIFIED IN THE WORKPLAN THE CENTER FOR ECOTECHNOLOGY (CET) SUBAWARD ACTIVITIES INCLUDES: 1) PILOT IMPLEMENTATION; CET AND CITY OF MIDDLETOWN TO MEET WITH RESTAURANTS AT PROJECT LAUNCH TO CONFIRM INTEREST AND PARTICIPATION 2) DEVELOP WEBPAGE FOR PILOT DESCRIPTION AS CALL OF ACTION TO OTHER INTERESTED MIDDLETOWN RESTAURANTS 2) RESEARCH AND SELECT MOST APPROPRIATE REUSABLE TAKEOUT CONTAINER VENDOR 3) ROLL-OUT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE REUSABLE CONTAINERS.  2) SHOWCASING RESULTS:  CET TO INTERVIEW PARTICIPATING RESTAURANTS, VENDOR, HEALTH DEPARTMENT, AND CITY OF MIDDLETOWN TO ASSESS CHALLENGES AND SUCCESSES 2) DOCUMENT SINGLE-USE TAKEOUT WASTE PREVENTED BY IMPLEMENTING REDUCTION AND REUSE MEASURES. 3) CASE STUDY; CET TO DEVELOP RESOURCES SHOWCASING BEST PRACTICES AND RECOMMENDATIONS FOR BUSINESSES INTERESTED IN REUSABLE CONTAINERS 2) CITY OF MIDDLETOWN AND CET TO DISTRIBUTE THE FINAL DOCUMENT WIDELY WITH RESTAURANTS AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS ACROSS CONNECTICUT AND BEYOND.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE PILOTING A CIRCULAR ECONOMY FOR REUSABLE TAKEOUT CONTAINERS AND SHOWCASING RESULTS IN A CASE STUDY.  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE CONSUMERS OF 3 RESTAURANTS AND THE RESIDENTS OF MIDDLETOWN CONNECTICUT WHO WILL GENERATE LESS WASTE AND CONSEQUENTLY GREENHOUSE GASES

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE ENVIRONMENT COUNCIL OF RHODE ISLAND EDUCATION FUND (ECRI) TO CONDUCT THEIR RHODE ISLAND SCHOOL RECYCLING CLUB 'GET FOOD SMART, RI; PHASE 3'.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT FOOD WASTE DIVERSION PROGRAMS AT FOUR RHODE ISLAND K-12 SCHOOLS TO SUPPORT THE NEW RHODE ISLAND STATE LAW TITLED 'SCHOOL WASTE RECYCLING AND REFUSE DISPOSAL' WHICH MANDATES THAT MOST SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN RHODE ISLAND DIVERT FOOD SCRAPS AWAY FROM RHODE ISLAND'S CENTRAL LANDFILL IN JOHNSTON AND RECOVER SURPLUS FOOD FOR REDISTRIBUTION OR DONATION BEGINNING JANUARY 2023. IN ADDITION, MONITORING ONGOING RESULTS WILL CONTINUE AT THE FOUR SCHOOLS FROM PHASE 2 OF THE PROJECT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES, UPDATE THE FOOD WASTE REDUCTION TOOLKIT FOR RHODE ISLAND SCHOOLS; RECRUIT SCHOOLS TO PARTICIPATE IN GET FOOD SMART RI AND FACILITATE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF PROGRAMS; MEASURE RESULTS WITH STUDENTS AND REDUCE FOOD WASTE WITH DATA; AND CREATE A RECOGNITION PROGRAM TO SHARE SUCCESSES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE STUDENTS AND RESIDENTS OF TARGET COMMUNITIES WHO WILL HAVE A DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS OF DISPOSAL OF WASTED FOOD INCLUDING BY DIVERTING FOOD WASTE FROM LANDFILL, THEREBY REDUCING METHANE GAS EMISSIONS THAT IMPACT CLIMATE CHANGE AND RECOVERING HEALTHY FOOD FOR REDISTRIBUTION WITHIN THE COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:THE 'HEALTHY HOMES, HEALTHY LIVES FOR REFUGEES' PROJECT SEEKS TO INCREASE REFUGEES' AWARENESS ABOUT HARMFUL AIR POLLUTANTS AND TO ULTIMATELY REDUCE INCIDENCES OF ASTHMA-RELATED EMERGENCIES AMONG CHILD REFUGEES IN RHODE ISLAND BY CONDUCTING PUBLIC AWARENESS AND EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND BY ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING HEALTHY HOMES RESPONSE TEAMS TO CONNECT FAMILIES TO RESOURCES AND PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL PRACTICES. ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES ANTICIPATED INCLUDE 1) CONDUCTING HOME VISITS TO PROVIDE REFUGEES WITH THE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND RESOURCES THEY NEED TO PROMOTE THE MANAGEMENT OF ASTHMA AND THE REDUCTION OF ASTHMA TRIGGERS AND OTHER INDOOR AIR POLLUTANTS, 2) HOSTING REFUGEE HOUSING ADVISORY NETWORK MEETINGS HELD EVERY OTHER MONTH AS A TEAM OF PARTNERS AND COMMUNITY LEADERS FOR A YEAR TO REVIEW JOURNEY TO HEALTH, HOME VISITS, GENERAL ISSUES RELATING TO HOUSING SAFETY, AND INDOOR AIR POLLUTANTS. THIS NETWORK WILL GROW OVER TIME TO INCLUDE MORE PARTNERS AND INCREASED COORDINATION BETWEEN EFFORTS TO ADDRESS HEALTHY HOME, 3) HOST MONTHLY ASTHMA-FOCUSED JOURNEY TO HEALTH SESSIONS WITH TRANSLATED AND CULTURALLY INFORMED EDUCATIONAL PAMPHLETS, AND 4) SUPPORTING CULTURALLY SPECIFIC SURVEY EFFORTS TO GAIN ASSESSMENTS OF THE EXTENT OF ASTHMA TRIGGERS IN HOMES OF REFUGEE CLIENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE MEASURABLE RESULTS WHICH THIS PROJECT WILL DELIVER CONSIST OF THE FOLLOWING:-IMPROVEMENT IN QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ASTHMATIC REFUGEES (TO BE QUANTIFIED IN THE FOLLOWING WAYS):-INCREASED NUMBER OF SYMPTOM-FREE DAYS IN REFUGEE CHILDREN AND ADULTS-REDUCTION IN USE OF RESCUE MEDICATIONS-REDUCTION IN NUMBER OF MISSED SCHOOL/WORK DAYS OWING TO RESPIRATORY ILLNESS-REDUCTION IN NUMBER OF ASTHMA-RELATED EMERGENCY ROOM VISITS, AND/OR HOSPITAL READMISSIONS RELATED TO ASTHMA-MEASURABLE DECREASE IN NUMBER OF ASTHMA TRIGGERS IN HOMES OF SURVEYED REFUGEE CLIENTS

DESCRIPTION:THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF OPERATION FUEL'S BETTER HOMES AND BUILDING PROGRAM (BHBP) IS TO INCREASE THE UTILIZATION OF CONNECTICUT'S WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM AND INSTALL 30 HEAT PUMPS IN SINGLE-FAMILY HOMES AND MULTI-RESIDENT RENTAL UNITS BY SEPTEMBER 2023, THEREBY DECREASING ENERGY BURDEN, CARBON FOOTPRINT, AND NEGATIVE HEALTH IMPACTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT, 'USING A PEER LEADERSHIP MODEL TO ENSURE CLEAN, GREEN AND HEALTHY SCHOOLS', BUILDS ON PREVIOUSLY-FUNDED SUCCESSES AND FITS WITHIN MASSACHUSETTS COALITION ON OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH'S MISSION OF DEVELOPING THE CAPACITY OF LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES OF COLOR TO ACHIEVE HEALTHY ENVIRONMENTS IN SCHOOLS, AT WORK AND IN NEIGHBORHOODS. DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO REDUCE THE QUANTITY OF WASTED FOOD ENTERING THE MUNICIPAL SOLID WASTE IN PROVIDENCE COUNTY. 
ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT FOOD BUSINESSES BY REDUCING, DIVERTING, OR MINIMIZING WASTED FOOD AND OTHER RECYCLABLE COMMODITIES, THEREBY BOLSTERING PROVIDENCE'S RESILIENCY BY IMPROVING THE HEALTH AND PRODUCTIVITY OF LOCAL AGRICULTURAL SOILS, AND REDUCING ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS ASSOCIATED WITH LANDFILLING FOOD WASTE. DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO BUILD CAPACITY AND SUPPORT COLLABORATION TO REDUCE THE BURDEN OF ASTHMA ACROSS NEW ENGLAND. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO BUILD KNOWLEDGE, IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES, AND STRENGTHEN CROSS-STATE COLLABORATIONS AND REGIONAL PARTNERSHIPS TO ADDRESS THE ENVIRONMENTAL CAUSES AND TRIGGERS FOR ASTHMA, AND WORK COLLECTIVELY WITH A FOCUS ON REDUCING ASTHMA HEALTH INEQUITIES TO IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR EVERYONE LIVING WITH ASTHMA IN NEW ENGLAND. RECOGNIZING THE MANY DIFFICULT IMPACTS OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, THIS PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY AND REFLECT ON THESE CHALLENGES AND, WHEN POSSIBLE, ACT AS A GROUP TO ADDRESS THEM. EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE CONTINUING TO INCREASE CAPACITY OF THE NE STATE ASTHMA PROGRAMS BY CONVENING AND SUPPORTING ASTHMA REGIONAL COUNCIL'S LEARNING COMMUNITY, ORGANIZING A NEW ENGLAND-WIDE SUMMIT, BROADLY FOCUSED ON LESSONS, CHALLENGES, AND OPPORTUNITIES, AND CONTINUING TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE NATIONAL DIALOGUE, SHARING EXPERIENCES FROM NEW ENGLAND IN CONVERSATIONS AND BEST PRACTICES FROM AROUND THE COUNTRY FOCUSED ON ASTHMA
ACTIVITIES:OBJECTIVE 1: COORDINATE THE SIX NEW ENGLAND STATE ASTHMA PROGRAMS TO SUPPORT/INCREASE REGIONAL COLLABORATION AND CAPACITY BUILDING. 
OBJECTIVE 2: PLAN AND HOLD ONE ASTHAMA REGIONAL COUNCIL'S SUMMIT FOR STATE AND LOCAL HEALTH DEPARTMENTS AND OTHER MULTI-SECTOR STAKEHOLDERS FROM THE SIX NEW ENGLAND STATES TO BUILD KNOWLEDGE ABOUT STRATEGIES AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR COLLABORATION TO OPTIMIZE ASTHMA OUTCOMES AND PROMOTE RACIAL/HEALTH EQUITY COMING OUT OF COVID 
OBJECTIVE 3: LEADERSHIP/PARTICIPATION IN CHILDHOOD ASTHMA REGIONAL COALITION AND COMMUNITY OF PRACTICESUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:OBJECTIVE 1: CONTINUE TO INCREASE CAPACITY OF THE NEW ENGLAND STATE ASTHMA PROGRAMS BY CONVENING AND SUPPORTING
ASTHMA REGIONAL COUNCIL'S LEARNING COMMUNITY. OUTPUTS INCLUDE: 1) SIX BI-MONTHLY VIRTUAL MEETINGS AND/OR TRAININGS; 2) ONE ALL-DAY
IN-PERSON CONVENING WITH REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE SIX NEW ENGLAND STATE ASTHMA PROGRAMS; AND 3) TECHNICAL ASSISTANTS PROVIDED TO
INDIVIDUAL PROGRAMS, AS NEEDED. FOR ALL OUTPUTS, THIS WILL INVOLVE CONTINUING TO 'UNPACK' EACH STATES' FIVE-YEAR
ASTHMA STRATEGIC PLAN, SUBMITTED TO THE CENTER FOR DISEASE CONTROL IN 2021, AND STRATEGIZE ON HOW TO MOVE FORWARD. EACH STATE'S PLAN
HAS SOME COMBINATION OF OBJECTIVES FOCUSING ON HEALTHY HOUSING, HEALTHY SCHOOLS, COMMUNITY-CLINICAL LINKAGES
(INCLUDING BUILDING CAPACITY AND SUSTAINABILITY FOR ASTHMA HOME VISITING WITH ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENTS),
AND/OR OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY, WITH PROMOTING RACIAL AND HEALTH EQUITY AS A CROSSCUTTING GUIDING PRINCIPLE. ARC WILL
FACILITATE THE SHARING OF IDEAS, TOOLS, LEARNINGS, CHALLENGES, AND OPPORTUNITIES, AS WELL AS ORGANIZE TRAININGS ON A
FEW TOPICS SPECIFIC TO THEIR NEEDS.
OBJECTIVE 2: ORGANIZE A NEW ENGLAND-WIDE ASTHMA REGIONAL COUNCIL SUMMIT, BROADLY FOCUSED ON LESSONS, CHALLENGES, AND OPPORTUNITIES. THE
EXACT THEME WILL BE DETERMINED WITH THE ASTHMA REGIONAL COUNCIL LEARNING COMMUNITY. OUTPUTS WILL INCLUDE: 1) PLANNING
COMMITTEE, WITH 2- 6 PARTICIPANTS, CONVENED TWO TO FOUR TIMES TO HELP TO IDENTIFY SPECIFIC LEARNING OBJECTIVES
AND OUTCOMES, EFFECTIVE SPEAKERS, AND TARGET AUDIENCE FOR ATTENDANCE; 2) ENVIRONMENTAL SCAN TO IDENTIFY
PROJECTS/SPEAKERS TO HIGHLIGHT; 3) SUMMIT HELD WITH 50-80 IN ATTENDANCE FROM STATE AND LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH
DEPARTMENTS, COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS, ASTHMA COALITIONS, ACADEMICS, ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY, AND
OTHER MULTI-SECTOR STAKEHOLDERS WORKING ON ISSUES RELATED TO ASTHMA. THE SUMMIT WILL SHOWCASE INNOVATIVE
PRACTICES AND PROJECTS FROM NEW ENGLAND AND NATIONALLY, AS WELL AS TOOLS, AND STRUCTURED TIME FOR PEER SHARING
4) SLIDES FROM THE SUMMIT MADE AVAILABLE FOR THE ASTHMA COMMUNITY NETWORK WEBSITE; AND 5)
ATTENDEES ENCOURAGED TO JOIN ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE CENTER FOR ECOTECHNOLOGY TO CONDUCT THEIR 'ACCELERATING WASTED FOOD SOLUTIONS IN CONNECTICUT' PROJECT. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE INCREASED OUTREACH TO TARGET SCHOOLS AND BUSINESSES, INCREASED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE DELIVERED TO SCHOOLS AND BUSINESSES, INCREASED MARKETPLACE ACTIVITY, A REDUCTION IN CO2, AND AN INCREASE IN WASTE DIVERTED FROM LANDFILL. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF TARGET COMMUNITIES WHO WILL HAVE A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY TO COMBAT THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS OF WASTED FOOD WHILE ADDRESSING ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH FOOD INSECURITY IN NEW HAVEN AND HARTFORD COUNTIES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO GROWING PLACES PROPOSES LOCAL FOOD WORKS-CLOSING THE LOOP PROJECT FOCUSED ON PREVENTING FOOD WASTE IN NORTH CENTRAL MASSACHUSETTS.ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP A CLOSED LOOP LOCAL FOOD SYSTEM THROUGH FOOD WASTE PREVENTION EFFORTS FOCUSED ON PRIMARY PRODUCERS, INSTITUTIONS, AND CONSUMERS. ENGAGE NEIGHBORHOOD-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, STUDENTS AND LOCAL FARMERS IN NORTH CENTRAL MASSACHUSETTS FOCUSING ON LEOMINSTER AND FITCHBURG. 

SUBRECIPIENT:THERE IS ONE SUBAWARD FOR INSTITUTIONAL FOOD WASTE PREVENTION PILOTS AT ONE FITCHBURG SCHOOL.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: INCREASE KNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS AMONG CONSUMERS ON THE IMPACTS OF FOOD WASTE AND DEVELOP AN UNDERSTANDING OF FOOD WASTE CAUSES AMONG PRIMARY PRODUCERS AND AT GROWING PLACES FOOD WAREHOUSE. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE TARGETED COMMUNITIES AND LOCAL FARMERS.  PUBLIC HEALTH IS IMPROVED VIA LOWER METHANE EMISSIONS FROM LANDFILLS TO REDUCE CLIMATE CHANGE, CLIMATE MITIGATED HIGH HEAT DAYS/WEATHER EVENTS, AND LOWER INCINERATOR EMISSIONS/REDUCED AIR POLLUTION. PRIMARY PRODUCERS USE LESS WATER, ENERGY, FERTILIZER AND PESTICIDES BECAUSE THEY ONLY GROW WHAT CONSUMERS USE. PRODUCE IS HANDLED EFFICIENTLY IN THE NCMA FOOD SYSTEM WITH REDUCED SPOILAGE AT ALL STAGES. LOW-INCOME FOOD INSECURE CONSUMERS REDUCE FOOD WASTE AND SAVE DOLLARS TO SPEND ON HEALTHCARE AND RENT. MUNICIPALITIES REDUCE LANDFILL COSTS, SO FUNDS ARE RE-DIRECTED TO RESIDENT SERVICES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE PRODUCT STEWARDSHIP INSTITUTE TO CONDUCT THEIR 'RESTAURANTS BUILDING BACK BETTER WITH LESS PACKAGING AND PLASTIC WASTE' PROJECT. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP AN OUTREACH CAMPAIGN, EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO HELP MASSACHUSETTS RESTAURANTS, INCLUDING SMALL RESTAURANTS IN LOW-INCOME AREAS, REDUCE SINGLE-USE FOOD WARE AND PLASTIC PACKAGING WASTE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE 5 EDUCATIONAL VIDEOS, AN OUTREACH CAMPAIGN THAT ENROLLS 5-10 RESTAURANTS, 5-10 SOURCE REDUCTION PLANS FOR PARTICIPANTS, A RESOURCE TOOLKIT, AND CASE STUDIES TRANSLATED INTO COMMUNITY-APPROPRIATE LANGUAGES. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A 40% REDUCTION IN SINGLE-USE PLASTIC ITEMS FOR PARTICIPATING RESTAURANTS, EQUALING 9,000 TO 18,000 POUNDS OF AVOIDED PLASTIC AND $10,000 TO $25,000 IN COST SAVINGS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE PARTICIPATING RESTAURANTS, WHO IMPROVE THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE AND REDUCE COSTS, AS WELL AS RESIDENTS AND WILDLIFE IN TARGET COMMUNITIES, WHO BENEFIT FROM THE REDUCED BURDEN OF PLASTIC POLLUTION.

PER YOUR APPLICATION REQUEST DATE MAY 2, 2021, THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS BEING AWARDED FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $28,021 TO THE BERKSHIRE REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION'S 'HEALTHY AND EFFICIENT HOMES PILOT PROJECT'.  THIS PILOT PROJECT WILL INCREASE AWARENESS OF HOUSEHOLD HAZARDS THAT HAVE BEEN LINKED TO POOR HEALTH OUTCOMES LIKE LEAD IN PAINT AND WATER, ASBESTOS, AND ASTHMA TRIGGERS LIKE MOLD AND MILDEW, PESTS, TOXIC CHEMICALS USED IN CLEANING AGENTS, PESTICIDES, AND PEST MANAGEMENT, SECONDHAND SMOKE, AND OTHER HAZARDS THAT ARISE THROUGH OUR INITIAL DATA COLLECTION EFFORTS. AT ITS CORE, THIS PROJECT AIMS TO REDUCE THE LIKELIHOOD TENANTS WILL BE EXPOSED TO MOLD WHEN MOISTURE PROBLEMS OCCUR IN THEIR UNITS, THUS REDUCING THE RISK OF HEALTH EFFECT FROM MOLD EXPOSURE. IT TAKES PROACTIVE STEPS TOWARDS CREATING A MOISTURE-MANAGED PROPERTY SYSTEM TO ADDRESS MOISTURE PROBLEMS IN RENTAL PROPERTIES BEFORE THEY IMPACT HUMAN HEALTH AND PRODUCTIVITY.

THIS PROJECT WILL DOCUMENT CURRENT INDUSTRY STANDARD PRACTICES, DEVELOP NEW APPROACHES, AND WORK TO DEMONSTRATE COST AND ENVIRONMENTAL SAVINGS THROUGH IMPLEMENTING BEST PRACTICES AND LESS TOXIC ALTERNATIVES. THE HAZARD IDENTIFICATION, INFRASTRUCTURE, RESILIENCE AND PLANNING PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE CITY OF NASHUA TO IMPROVE ITS PREPAREDNESS, RESPONSE, AND RECOVERY TIME WHEN FACED WITH CASCADING IMPACTS FROM A SEVERE URBAN FLOODING EVENT. IMPACTS INCLUDE INFRASTRUCTURE DAMAGE, DRINKING WATER CONTAMINATION, AND CESSATION OF PUBLIC AND COMMUNITY SERVICES. THE PROJECT WILL COMPLETE A VULNERABILITY ASSESSMENT, PUBLISH A RESILIENCY PLAN, IMPLEMENT A RESILIENCY AND RECOVERY WORKSHOP, AND CONDUCT A RECOVERY TABLETOP EXERCISE THAT IDENTIFIES PREPAREDNESS GAPS. THE PUBLICATIONS WILL BE SHARED WITH 234 NEW HAMPSHIRE TOWNS AND INVOLVE 50 COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS, 75 BUSINESSES, AND 3,000 INDIVIDUALS.
